titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Los Angeles Daily News Negatives, 1925-1954
titlestmt.author: Processed by UCLA Library Special Collections staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé and edited by Josh Fiala.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: The Regents of the University of California. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid created by ByteManagers using OAC finding aid conversion service specifications, encoding added via Notetab Pro. Online finding aid edited by Josh Fiala. Date of source: August 2001.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Describing Archives: a Content Standard

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Los Angeles Daily News Negatives,
did.abstract: The Los Angeles daily news was originally named the Illustrated Daily News by Cornelius Vanderbilt, Jr. when he started it in 1923. He copied the tabloid format of the New York daily news, although he rejected lurid and sensational journalism. In 1926 the paper went bankrupt and was taken over by Manchester Boddy, who changed the name to the Los Angeles daily news. He kept the tabloid format, with its heavy reliance on photographs. In 1954 it merged with the Mirror, the afternoon paper of the Los Angeles times, and became the Mirror-News. It lost reporters, columnists, and its more liberal flavor, and ceased publication in the early 1960s. The collection consists of 200,000 negatives of the Los Angeles Daily News.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Library Special Collections.

did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Advance notice required for access.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Los Angeles Daily News Negatives (Collection 1387). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The Los Angeles daily news was originally named the Illustrated daily news by Cornelius Vanderbilt, Jr. when he started it in 1923. He copied the tabloid format of the New York daily news, although he rejected lurid and sensational journalism. In 1926 the paper went bankrupt and was taken over by Manchester Boddy, who changed the name to the Los Angeles daily news. He kept the tabloid format, with its heavy reliance on photographs. In 1954 it merged with the Mirror, the afternoon paper of the Los Angeles times, and became the Mirror-News. It lost reporters, columnists, and its more liberal flavor, and ceased publication in the early 1960s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of 200,000 negatives of the Los Angeles daily news.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Negatives (Boxes 1-197, 254-301).
Glass negatives (Boxes 198-253).

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

list.item: 20,000 (a 10% sample) of these negatives were printed and indexed to form Collection 1386. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Los Angeles Daily News Records (Collection 1208). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library.
Los Angeles Daily News Photographs (Collection 1386) . Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library.
